entry.title: Advice on Payment Term Configuration in OBB8
entry.content:
Hi SAP experts,

I have question on how to achieve these scenarios from OBB8 configuration:

1. Invoice dated 15 August 2025 with document due on 31.10.2025 and paid in F110 on 31 October 2025 - Entitle for % discount (Pass)
2. Invoice dated 15 July 2025 with document due on 30.09.2025 and paid in F110 on 31 October 2025 - Not entitle for discount (Failed - SAP still showing discount for this document)
3. Invoice dated 15 October 2025 - Shouldn't appear in F110 payment listing (Pass)
 
I have set configuration Payment term Z061:
Term 1: Percentage (1.5%) / Fixed Date (31) / Additional Months (2) - which is failed at 2nd scenario.
 
From my understanding, this vendor only has 1 term.
Due date must always EOM + 2 Months together with discount. If the document is paid after due, no discount should apply at F110.

entry.title: Re: How the Due Date and Reminder determined in task of C...
entry.content: Please feel free to ask further queries here.

entry.title: Re: How the Due Date and Reminder determined in task of C...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

If the settings in the Fine Tuning Activity Business Task Management for Contracts and Customer Returns for the date is set as 60 Days before Contract End Date and the settings in the Reminder field of the Contract is set as 30 Days, then a reminder is sent on 60 days before the Contract End Date as this is the earlier date. However, if these were switched, it would be sent because of what is maintained in the reminder field, as this would be the earlier date.

The data maintained in the Business Configuration activity "Business Task Management for Contracts and Customer Returns" is what is considered always. In this activity, for the Activation Date, if you select the condition "Date and Time for Task Activation" then the Reminder days maintained in the Contract will be used. The system will check the Business Configuration settings when the contract is created or when the contract is renewed. The system will not send a reminder for a contract if nothing had been maintained in the Business Configuration when the contract first started or was last renewed. A change made in the Business Configuration afterwards will not be considered for the contract.

The task is only sent when the Contract Validity is Active.

Regards,

Arjun T H

SAP Product Support

entry.title: How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted into their respective depreciation periods?
entry.content:
How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted into their respective depreciation periods when the wrong period is selected during a depreciation job?

For example, if the job for September has been completed and then the job for November was run directly.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How can depreciation values be adjusted to be posted...
entry.content:
A new time interval needs to be added.

For instance, if an error occurs in November, we can add a new time interval on October 01 2025 in the app "Manage Fixed Assets". Then, adjust the depreciation key to 0000 and run the planned asset accounting job "Depreciation Posting - Period 11." Next, change the depreciation key back to its previous setting, and sequentially run the asset jobs "Depreciation Posting - Period 10" and "Depreciation Posting - Period 11."

3593095 - How to adjust depreciation values to post them into their respective periods after being posted together - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me

entry.title: Access FLP of S/4HANA Rise in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Folks,

 

Writing this blog after long analysis. I hope this will help community to fix the issue.

Requirement: Access the Fiori Launchpad of SAP S/4HANA Rise (Private Cloud) in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Analysis: In the Build Work Zone, standard edition site we need to add a new Role which should open the FLP of the S/4HANA system which is Private Cloud. SSO should work between Work Zone and Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA System.

Implementation: Below are the implementation steps in work zone:

1. Add the S/4HANA system in the Cloud Connector with https port

2. Configure the SSO using Principal Propagation so that it wont ask the credentials.

3. Set up the Custom IAS and SSO for Work Zone applicaiton.

4. Create a app, page, space, role in work zone and assing the role to user. PFA the app configuration which will use to connect Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA system. (App configuration for FLP in Work Zone.jpg)

Error: Once all the configuration in placed, we will access the FLP in the work zone and below error will come. PFA the error screenshot (Error when accessing FLP in Work Zone.jpgüòû

Error

App could not be opened either due to an incorrect SAP Fiori launchpad configuration or a missing role assignment.

Solution: After lot of analysis not found any blog for this solution and finally found the solution by uncheck the property in the work zone app "Add intent and default SAP parameters to URL" and save. PFA the screen shot for same ()

After saving, access the FLP again and it open the Fiori Launchpad of S/4HANA On Premise. PFA the working scenario (FLP of S4HANA working in Work Zone.jpg)

Please let me know your feedback if someone is able to fix the issue or having any other issue while configuriing the same.

 

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: Re: Employee Central IBAN bank validation
entry.content:
Hi @Mikkelsen ,

The business rules framework unfortunately causes precision loss when converting a very large number of Java type Long. Long is used internally in the business rules framework when you use the "To Number()" function with the incoming String containing a large number. As a workaround, you can concatenate a ".0" to the String containing the large number. In this case, a decimal number will be generated by the "To Number()" function instead of a Long. As a result, no conversion is needed when you use for example the rule function "Modulo()" for this number.

entry.title: How to calculate monthly planned hours in Story Reports based on actual working days?
entry.content:
Good morning,

I‚Äôm working on a reporting scenario in SAP SuccessFactors where I need to calculate monthly planned working hours for employees in a query. The challenge is that the calculation should reflect the actual number of working days in the month, not just use a fixed average like 176.4 hours * FTE.

This assumes 21 working days per month (8.4 hours per day), which is only an approximation. However, actual working days vary by month.

Question:
How can we build a calculation in a Story Report or query that dynamically determines the correct number of working days per month and multiplies by daily hours and FTE? Any best practices or examples would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,
Alex

entry.title: Re: Employee Central IBAN bank validation
entry.content:
Hi @Mikkelsen ,

Unfortunately, the business rules cause precision loss if a very large number of Java type Long is converted. The Java type Long is used as the output of the rule function "To Number()" if the input is a String containing a very large number without decimal point. As a workaround, you can concatenate a ".0" to the String. In this case, "To Number()" returns a decimal type and no conversion is needed if you use this number for a rule function like "Modulo()".

entry.title: Re: Smarter Built-In Support in C4C: A Unified and Upgraded Experience
entry.content:
Just to clarify, this upgrade is not optional. It will be deployed to all tenants during the next productive upgrade, which is about a week from now.
Once the upgrade is applied, sending cases to SAP will only be possible through the new Built-In Support. All references to ‚ÄúSend to Provider‚Äù will be removed from the legacy tool.

The first version of the legacy Built-In Support will still remain visible under Administrator ‚Üí Cases. End users will still be able to create internal tickets there, and key users will still be able to support their end users.
However, creating cases to send to SAP will be exclusively available in the new Built-In Support.

Also, with this change, internal tickets and SAP tickets will be fully separated. Internal tickets remain in the legacy view, while SAP cases must be created and managed in the new Built-In Support.

My possible solutions are to set up a virtual machine on my PC with the older version or use a different PC.

entry.title: Re: Split WT during Putaway ‰∏çÂêØÁî®HUÂåÖË£ÖÁÆ°ÁêÜÔºå‰ªìÂ∫ì‰∏äÊû∂Ê†πÊçÆÂçïÊâòÈáçÈáèÊãÜÂàÜË°å‰∏äÊû∂ÈúÄÊ±ÇÂºÄÂèë...
entry.content:
Hi,

 

As far as I know it is not possible to split the WT due to weight directly without capacity check for specific destination bin.

In your case, you may consider below workaround:

  1. Define alternative UoM for material.
  2. Set "Round to Whole Unit" as "Round Down WT Quantity as Single Unit" at Customizing "Maintain Storage Types" for source bin of putaway WT or set ti Round Whole Units at customizing "Define Warehouse Process Type".

For example, the Base Unit is PC and UoM conversion is set as 1 PAL = 5 PC.

Then when you create putaway task for requested quantity 12 PC, the putaway WT will be split as 5 + 5 + 2.

Hope it helps.

entry.title: Timeouts When Maintaining Large Business Roles in S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL ‚Äì CBC)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

In our S/4HANA Public Cloud 3SL (CBC) Development and Test tenants, we are experiencing persistent issues when maintaining a large business role that includes all available business catalogs (currently more than 1,400).

Whenever we try to update an existing super-user role that already contains approximately 1,000 catalogs, or when we attempt to create a new role containing all catalogs through the ‚ÄúMaintain Business Roles‚Äù Fiori app, we receive TimeOut or RunTime errors.

We use this wide-access role for key users to quickly determine whether issues raised by stakeholders‚Äîsuch as after activating new scope items or after upgrades‚Äîare related to missing authorizations.

I would appreciate hearing from anyone who has encountered similar challenges. How did you resolve or work around these performance limitations?

Additionally, is there a way to build such a role using the ‚ÄúCreate From Template‚Äù option instead of manually adding each catalog through the UI? If so, where can the template be found and which fields are required for a successful upload?

Thank you in advance for your insights.

Kind regards,
Mike van Ingen

entry.title: Getting Started with the SAP Signavio Transformation Manager APIs: Initiatives & Insights
entry.content:
First Things First: What Are These APIs for? 

The SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager APIs, comprising the Initiatives API and Insights API, extend the capabilities of SAP Signavio Transformation Manager to developers, partners, and customers who want to integrate, automate, and scale transformation efforts programmatically. 

Use it when you need to: 

  • Create, read, update, or delete initiatives programmatically. 
  • Search, sort, or filter initiatives based on status, owner, or value driver. 
  • Maintain governance and access control through standardized endpoints. 
  • Create, read, update, or delete insights. 
  • Connect insights to one or more initiatives. 
  • Connect initiatives and insights seamlessly with project management tools, analytics platforms, or custom applications.‚ÄØ 

How Do I Access the APIs? 

Similar to SAP Signavio Process Manager APIs, it uses token-based authentication, so you don‚Äôt even need to copy cookies! The Transformation Manager APIs use token-based authentication and the same setup steps for technical users and license assignments. 

Currently, a Transformation Hub User provides full CRUD API access under a paid customer license, while all workspace users can perform read (GET) operations at no cost, and write actions (POST, PUT, DELETE) on Initiatives, Insights, Objectives, and Tasks require a Transformation Manager license (see attached screenshot). 

üí°Tip: For additional information please check out Getting Started with SAP Signavio Process Manager API Blog Post.  

How Do I Obtain a Token? 

Before we start exploring the API endpoints, let‚Äôs first look at how to authenticate and obtain your token.  

Request: 

POST https://{{host}}/auth/v1/token
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

You can find the correct host in the SAP Help documentation. 

Form Parameters: 

tokenonly=true
name=<your_email_address>
password=<your_password>
tenant=<workspace_tenant_id>

Response:
If successful, the API returns 200 OK, and the JWT is provided directly in the response body. If authentication fails, you may receive: 

  • 400 Bad Request: Incorrect parameter format (e.g., password sent as query string). 
  • 401 Unauthorized: Invalid credentials. 
  • 302 Found: Returned when tokenonly=true is omitted. 

Usage:
Include the JWT in the header for all subsequent API requests:

x-signavio-id: <your_token>

üí°Tip: You can find your workspace tenant ID in SAP Help documentation. Tokens remain valid for 8 hours, so request a new one after expiry to continue using the API. 

What Are the Key Entities in the APIs? 

After obtaining your token, you can start creating and managing initiatives and insights programmatically. 

Understanding the main entities helps you navigate both APIs more easily. In essence, the Transformation Manager APIs revolve around a few key objects: 

  • Initiatives: Represent transformation programs or projects that drive organizational change. 
  • Insights: Capture process findings or improvement ideas identified during analysis.

Dig Into Specific Requests and Responses

Once you‚Äôve set up authentication, you can start creating new initiatives directly through the API. Let‚Äôs look at how to do this with the Initiatives API.

Example 1: Create a New Initiative

The creation endpoint is a simple POST request to:

https://{{host}}/transformationmanager/v1/initiatives

You can find the correct host in the SAP Help documentation.

Request:

POST https://{{host}}/transformationmanager/v1/initiatives
Authorization: Bearer <your_token>
Content-Type: application/json

Body:

{
  "name": "Digital Supply Chain Optimization",
  "description": "End-to-end program to improve delivery times and reduce logistics cost.",
  "status": "PLANNING",
  "valueDrivers": [
"REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST", 
"IMPROVE_ON_TIME_DELIVERY"
],
  "authorizations": [
    {
      "targetType": "USER",
      "targetId": "<user_UUID>",
      "role": "OWNER"
    }
  ]
}

 Note: The status and valueDrivers fields accept only predefined values (for example, PLANNING, COMPLETED, REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST). For the full list, see the SAP Help documentation.

üí°Tip: To create or update Insights and Initiatives, you need the UUID of the technical user used for the API.  Since there‚Äôs no public endpoint for user details, you can find this UUID directly in SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub:

  1. Go to Settings ‚ûî User management.
  2. Search and select the technical user that‚Äôs used for the API.
  3. Copy the UUID from the browser URL. It appears as:
    https://editor.signavio.com/.../users/<UUID
  4. Use this UUID in your API payloads under the authorizations.targetId or assignees field.

Response:

{ 
  "id": "<initiative_UUID>", 
  "name": "Digital Supply Chain Optimization",
  "status": "PLANNING",
  "type": "STANDARD", 
  "valueDrivers": [
    "REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST", 
    "IMPROVE_ON_TIME_DELIVERY" 
  ], 
  "authorizations": [ 
     { 
       "target": { 
         "id": "<user_UUID>", 
         "displayName": "John Doe"
      }, 
      "targetType": "USER", 
      "role": "OWNER"
    }
  ],
  "dateCreated": "2025-11-03T13:15:32Z" 
}

üí°Tip: You can automate initiative creation when a new opportunity or improvement program is approved in your project management or analytics tool. Simply trigger this endpoint with your system‚Äôs event to keep SAP Signavio Transformation Manager in sync automatically.

Now, let‚Äôs move to filtering insights, another key operation you can perform once your initiatives are created.

Example 2:  Filter Insights with Multiple Parameters

This is a simple GET request to:

https://{{host}}/transformationmanager/v1/insights?status=OPEN&valueDriver=REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST&nameContains=Delivery&sortBy=dateCreated&sortOrder=Descending&pageSize=3
Authorization: Bearer <your_token> 
Content-Type: application/json

In this example, the request retrieves all insights where the status is OPEN,the valueDriver includes REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST, and the name contains the term ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù.  The results are sorted by creation date in descending order, showing the most recently created insights first. The pageSize=3 parameter limits the response to three insights for demonstration purposes.

Make sure you use the correct host from the SAP Help documentation, similar to the previous example.

Response:

{ 
  "id": "<insight_UUID>", 
  "name": "Delivery Route Optimization",
  "description": "Reducing logistics costs by improving delivery route efficiency",
  "status": "OPEN", 
  "valueDrivers": [
    "REDUCE_LOGISTICS_COST", 
    "IMPROVE_ON_TIME_DELIVERY" 
  ], 
  "impactScore": 8.2, 
   "effortScore": 3.5,
   "priorityScore": 9.0,
   "assignees": [ 
     { 
       "id": "<user_UUID>", 
       "displayName": "John Doe"
       "email": "john.doe@example.com",
  ],
  "authorizations": [ 
     { 
       "target": { 
         "id": "<user_UUID>", 
         "displayName": "John Doe"
      }, 
      "targetType": "USER", 
      "role": "OWNER"
    }
  ],
  "dateCreated": "2025-10-12T14:32:00Z" 
  "dateUpdated": "2025-11-03T13:15:32Z"
}

 

What Happens When Things Go Wrong?

Sooner or later, an API call might fail, but the good news is, Transformation Manager gives you clear responses and tools to troubleshoot.

Here are a few quick tips to keep in mind:

  1. Check the response code
    Most errors use standard HTTP codes:
  • 400: Invalid request or missing field
  • 401: Invalid or expired token
  • 403: Not enough permissions
  • 404: Resource not found

       2. Verify your authentication token
       If you see 401, make sure your JWT hasn‚Äôt expired (tokens are valid for 8 hours). Simply request a new one via /auth/v1/token.

       3. Confirm your workspace access
       A 403 often means the technical user doesn‚Äôt have the correct role or license. Check authorization settings in your Signavio     workspace.

        4. Inspect the request payload
        For 400 errors, validate your JSON body. Field names, value types, and nesting must match the API schema.

If the issue persists, open a support ticket in SAP for Me for BPI-SIG-CA-II component, and include your tenant ID, request body, and response log to speed up investigation. 

Don‚Äôt Forget About Rate Limits

Usage of Transformation Manager APIs is monitored to ensure reliable performance and fair access for all tenants. To prevent overload, rate limits define how many requests your applications can send within a given time window. You can find detailed thresholds and best practices in the SAP Help Documentation. 

Summary & Best Practices

The SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager APIs provide a powerful way to extend Transformation Manager programmatically from managing initiatives and insights to integrating with analytics and project management systems.

Here are a few tips to make the most of them:

  • Use technical users only
    Always authenticate with a dedicated technical user holding an API Edition license. Avoid personal accounts for better security and maintainability.
  • Reuse tokens efficiently
    Tokens remain valid for 8 hours. Cache and reuse them within that window instead of requesting new ones for every API call.
  • Keep initiatives and insights in sync
    Link insights to initiative IDs to maintain end-to-end traceability between analysis, planning, and execution.
  • Monitor and automate
    Use health check endpoints in your CI/CD pipelines or monitoring dashboards to detect issues early and ensure consistent uptime.
  • Use enums and structured data
    Define and reuse enums for fields like status and valueDriver to maintain consistency across systems.
  • Paginate and sort server-side
    When working with large datasets, always apply pagination and sorting through API parameters for better performance.
  • Link related assets
    Associate dashboards, process models, or tasks via the AssetEntity field to ensure end-to-end traceability.

‚ú®Together, these practices help you build stable, efficient integrations, and make the most out of the Transformation Manager APIs within your SAP Signavio landscape.

Join the Developer Community

Have a question? Built something cool? Share it via signavio_ecosystem@sap.com!

The SAP Signavio developer community is a growing space where users share what they‚Äôve built, ask questions, and exchange best practices. Whether you're stuck on a request, looking for inspiration, or want to showcase your latest integration, this is the place to be.

üß† Make sure to check out our blog posts for more ideas and insights.

Thanks for reading! üéâ

I hope this guide gave you a solid foundation to start building and maybe even sparked some ideas along the way.

entry.content:
Helo Ramu,

Based on my experience, I‚Äôd see the following:

(i) You might have multiple pipelines running in your tenant. Although I haven‚Äôt yet encountered a scenario with separate pipelines per team, I have seen multiple pipelines used for distinct messages with different priorities, or to segregate scenarios containing sensitive data. If teams should not see or operate on messages from other teams, then yes, that setup would be beneficial.

(ii) Normally, customers migrate system by system. However, this depends on whether you have single interfaces operating across multiple plants and whether that would have any operational impact.

(iii) There is no one-size-fits-all guidance here, especially for areas such as Resource Management. If you‚Äôll have multiple teams working within the same SAP Integration Suite tenant, it‚Äôs important to start with good governance and clearly define access policies, naming conventions, and related standards.

To stablish a good governance, I'd recommend to look at the ISA-M: https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-btp-guidance-framework/sap-integration-solution-advisory-methodology/sap-integration-solution-advisory-methodology-overview?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

More specifically for user accesses and policies, I'd recommend the links below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/configuring-user-access?version=CLOUD
https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/identity-and-access-management?version=CLOUD
https://help.sap.com/docs/integration-suite/sap-integration-suite/managing-access-policies?version=CLOUD


Finally, I'd recommend to take a look on the Migration Guide at the "Landscape" section, and also make sure test and get confidence how to operate with one or multiple pipelines. That will accelerate how you migrate interfaces in the long-term
https://help.sap.com/docs/migration-guide-po/migration-guide-for-sap-process-orchestration/migration-guide-sap-process-orchestration?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 Email Alert Configuration
entry.content:
It doesn't matter if you configure email settings in SLD or in General settings. The option to set it up in General settings only enables you to define it for each company separately, while SLD setup is valid for all companies on the server.

Regarding prerequisites, there are few:

1. Obviously you need to enable comminication between SLD and SMTP server via port that is used for SMTP (usually 587, but that is for you to know). What security layers you need to configure, that is also for you to know as it is your environment.

2. Your SMTP server needs to be enabled for third party apps connection. Might be a different name, but it's a setting that enables various apps to connect to SMTP and use it to send emails.

3. AlertSvc user (or Workflow on more recent versions) should not be locked, should be marked superuser and shuld have a default language selected (one of the system languages, not custom language).

4. When you connect to SMTP, you connect via certain user credentials that you set up in SLD, for example sld@test.com. Email address used for sending alerts is the one defined in company details, general tab. If these two emails are not the same, for example you set company@test.com in Company details, then you need to make sure that sld@test.com account has authorization to send emails on behalf of company@test.com. 

Never had an issue after I set all of these points up.

entry.title: Re: API or function to Reject CR of BP in MDG
entry.content:
@Kevin_zzj 

Here's another option to consider:

In the Rule-Based Workflow - within the Single Value Decision Table, add an additional row with the following configuration:

  • CR Previous Step: DS (Data Steward)
  • Previous Action: 04 (Reject)
  • New Change Request Step: 40
  • New CR Status: 01

Best regards,
Sandeep Suggu.

entry.title: Handling RFC Queue Errors in SAP EWM Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In SAP EWM Public Cloud, you can view and reprocess RFC queue errors directly from the Warehouse Monitor. Pending queues are visible there, and you can reprocess them once the underlying issue is resolved.

The real problem starts when the error has no actual fix. For example, an inbound delivery that was already put away, but the logistics period was afterward shifted. This leaves you with an RFC error you cannot resolve, and when you open the queue details there is no option to influence the data container, such as adjusting the posting date. Rejecting the queue does not work either.

Transaction /SCWM/ERP_STOCKCHECK technically exists, but since the queue is still present, you cannot clean up the situation through that check. The only app that seems remotely comparable to transaction SQM2 is F5427 (Manage Queue), yet it does not display anything relevant here.

Question
How can these unresolvable RFC queue errors be corrected in SAP EWM Public Cloud?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: How do I add international freight and insurance cost...
entry.content:
Hello all,

We‚Äôve found a practical workaround to address this scenario. Instead of generating three separate POs‚Äîone each for material, freight, and customs/insurance‚Äîwe created a single international PO with two additional condition types for freight and insurance. At the creation stage, you‚Äôll need to enter estimated amounts for these charges, as exact figures are usually unavailable upfront. You can assign a different supplier to each condition type.

When performing goods receipt (GRN), all costs (material, freight, insurance) are added to the material value. Afterwards, you can reference this single PO to create three separate supplier invoices, each corresponding to the appropriate supplier. Since the actual freight cost is often determined only at invoicing, you can use the unplanned delivery cost field to adjust the amount during invoice posting.

Pros:

All charges (including those from multiple suppliers) are included in the material value.

There‚Äôs no need to create multiple POs, even though the option to split POs isn‚Äôt available (based on current research).

Cons:

If you issue or sell the material before invoicing, any subsequent cost adjustment will not update the inventory ledger, but instead be posted to the price difference (expense) ledger.

For supplier communications, you‚Äôll need to develop additional print forms to accommodate the new process.

Please refer to the following link for more clarification.

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/planned-delivery-cost-of-purchasing-in-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition/ba-p/13572608?utm_source=chatgpt.com

Best Regards,

Nithin
